perturbation.original_text: 2. OGLE TO USE ENDORSED PRODUCT. Consolidated Artists agrees to cause Ogle to use the Endorsed Product during the Contract Period and throughout the Contract Territory whenever he is playing competitive golf or otherwise participating in golf clinics and outings.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. OGLE TO USE ENDORSED PRODUCT. Consolidated Artists agrees to use reasonable efforts to cause Ogle to use the Endorsed Product during the Contract Period and throughout the Contract Territory when appearing at TPC sponsored events.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates Ogle's use of the product 'whenever he is playing competitive golf or otherwise participating in golf clinics and outings.' The modified text changes this to 'reasonable efforts' and limits the usage to 'TPC sponsored events'. This creates a contradiction if other sections of the contract assume Ogle's broader usage of the product.

perturbation.original_text: 8. RETAINER FEE. In consideration of the rights and benefits granted to TPC hereunder, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a retainer fee in each Contract Year during the Contract Period ("Retainer Fee") in accordance with the following schedule: CONTRACT YEAR RETAINER FEE First (1st) Contract Year Fifty-Five Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1996-Dec. 31, 1996) Dollars ($55,000) Second (2nd) Contract Year Seventy Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1997-Dec. 31, 1997) Dollars (70,000) Third (3rd) Contract Year Ninety Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1998-Dec. 31, 1998) Dollars ($90,000) Said Retainer Fee shall be paid in four (4) equal installments on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. RETAINER FEE. In consideration of the rights and benefits granted to TPC hereunder, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a retainer fee in each Contract Year during the Contract Period ("Retainer Fee") in accordance with the following schedule: CONTRACT YEAR RETAINER FEE First (1st) Contract Year Fifty-Five Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1996-Dec. 31, 1996) Dollars ($55,000) Second (2nd) Contract Year Seventy Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1997-Dec. 31, 1997) Dollars (70,000) Third (3rd) Contract Year Ninety Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1998-Dec. 31, 1998) Dollars ($90,000) Said Retainer Fee *may* be paid in four (4) equal installments on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states 'Said Retainer Fee shall be paid', making the payment schedule mandatory. The modified text changes 'shall' to 'may', making the payment schedule optional. This introduces a contradiction as it's unclear whether the retainer fee must be paid in installments or if an alternative arrangement is acceptable, creating uncertainty in financial obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 15. MINIMUM PLAY REQUIREMENT. TPC shall have the right to prorate the Retainer Fee due Consolidated Artists upon fourteen (14) days written notice to Consolidated Artists or Advantage in the event Ogle fails to play a minimum of seventeen (17) U.S. PGA - 11 - Tour Events and the British Open in each Contract Year during the Contract Period.
perturbation.changed_text: 15. MINIMUM PLAY REQUIREMENT. TPC shall have the right to prorate the Retainer Fee due Consolidated Artists upon fourteen (14) days written notice to Consolidated Artists or Advantage in the event Ogle *chooses* to play a minimum of seventeen (17) U.S. PGA - 11 - Tour Events and the British Open in each Contract Year during the Contract Period.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, the proration of the Retainer Fee is linked to Ogle failing to meet the minimum play requirement. The modification changes the condition to Ogle 'choosing' to play, implying that the proration applies if he *does* meet the minimum play requirement. This creates an internal conflict regarding the conditions for proration. This is creating uncertainty regarding when the proration happens.
